actions.committee: Senate Committee on Labor and Public Welfare
actions.text: Referred to Senate Committee on Labor and Public Welfare.

official_title: A bill to amend the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Provides that no person shall serve colored oleomargarine or colored margarine at a public eating place, whether or not any charge is made therefor, unless: (1) a notice that oleomargarine or margarine is served is displayed prominently and conspicuously in such place and in such manner as to render it likely to be read and understood by the ordinary individual being served in such eating place, (2) a notice that oleomargarine or margarine is served is printed on the menu; or (3) each separate serving is accompanied by a labeling identifying it as oleomargarine or margarine. (Amends 21 U.S.C. 347 (c))

titles.title: A bill to amend the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act, and for other purposes.
